meanings.definition: Force (something unwelcome or unfamiliar) to be accepted or put in place.
meanings.sent1: The teacher imposes a strict no-talking rule during exams.
meanings.sent2: The government imposes a new tax on imported goods.
meanings.sent3: The cat imposes its presence on the dog by sitting on its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The storm imposes its power on the fragile trees, bending them with its strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The dictator imposes harsh restrictions on the citizens, controlling every aspect of their lives.

meanings.definition: Establish or apply (a rule or law).
meanings.sent1: The school imposes a dress code to maintain a professional environment.
meanings.sent2: The judge imposes a sentence on the criminal for their actions.
meanings.sent3: The toddler imposes their own bedtime rule by refusing to sleep early.
meanings.sent4: The CEO imposes a new policy to improve productivity in the company.
meanings.sent5: The coach imposes strict training schedules on the athletes to enhance their performance.

meanings.sent1: The prankster imposes a silly hat on the unsuspecting friend.
meanings.sent2: The bully imposes fear on the weaker students in the school.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf imposes a never-ending tickle spell on the wizard.
meanings.sent4: The ghost imposes a sense of dread on anyone who enters the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The annoying neighbor imposes loud music on the entire street, disrupting their peace.
